page.title: 04Transport(Ermine Street)
page.content: The B6403 or Ermine Street runs parallel to the A1 before merging with it at Colsterworth.It was part of one of the most important roads in Roman times,linking London with Lincoln.At that time Lincoln was a far more important city and had a fort. The main characteristics of a Roman road can be seen in this block.It is very straight although it undulates and curves in a long arc.There are several villages along this road which got their names from these times. (eg.Ancaster,Which was a garrison town).There are Roman remains near the road in our 'D' block(eg.A Roman pavement at Great Ponton and a tumulus at Little Ponton). Today the road serves as a backway to Lincoln off the A1.It is fairly busy with many refrigerator lorries travelling to Easton cold store.
